summary: Tested contextual bug linking feature. All 16 backend API tests passed. Frontend LinkedBugs component renders correctly on Stories page. Fixed severity mismatch bug in LinkedBugs.jsx (was using major/minor/trivial instead of high/medium/low).

bugs_fixed.issue: SEVERITY_CONFIG used incorrect values (major/minor/trivial) instead of backend values (high/medium/low)
bugs_fixed.fix: Updated SEVERITY_CONFIG to use critical/high/medium/low to match backend BugSeverity enum

seed_data_creation: None - test data cleaned up after tests
context_for_next_testing_agent: Contextual bug linking is fully functional. LinkedBugs component renders on Stories page in story detail dialog. Backend APIs for bug linking (by-entity, add links, remove links) all working. Severity values are now correctly aligned between frontend and backend.

backend_apis: GET /api/bugs/by-entity/{entity_type}/{entity_id} - Returns bugs linked to entity
POST /api/bugs - Create bug with links array
POST /api/bugs/{bug_id}/links - Add links to existing bug
frontend_components: LinkedBugs component renders in Story detail dialog
Report Bug button opens create dialog
Create bug with link works correctly
Bug cards show severity and status badges

notes: Epic page LinkedBugs component only shows when epic is locked (isEpicLocked=true). StoryPlanning page LinkedBugs shows in feature detail. Both were not tested due to requiring locked epics/features, but the component code is the same as tested in Stories page.
